intro: Porpax nana, commonly known as the dwarf porpax, is a small herbaceous plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Porpax nana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
